impact.statement: People around the world experience and enjoy a single, unified Web that works consistently across devices, browsers, and platforms, ensuring users can freely choose the tools they want to interact with the Web.

outcomes.statement: Open Web standards are implemented consistently across independent Web implementations including browsers, embedded runtimes, conferencing platforms using WebRTC, mini-app environments, APIs, and other Web runtimes.

indicators.description: Cross-implementation conformance test pass rates consistently increase
Reduction in implementation-specific compatibility issues
Interoperability scores across independent implementations consistently increase

outputs.statement: Working Groups adopt requirements and publish open, royalty-free Web standards that define interoperable technical foundations.

indicators.description: Number of features adopted into standards
Number of W3C Recommendations published
Time from proposal submission to feature adoption

outputs.statement: Interoperability test suites and conformance tools are developed and maintained that enable implementers to verify correct and consistent implementation of Web standards.

indicators.description: Number of interoperability test cases
Test coverage of standardized features
Conformance rates across implementations

outcomes.statement: Open Web standards are widely adopted across diverse implementation environments and remain the common technical foundation for Web functionality.

indicators.description: Number of independent conforming implementations
Percentage of widely used Web features supported across implementations
Implementation coverage of W3C Recommendations

outputs.statement: Working Groups adopt requirements and publish open, royalty-free Web standards that define interoperable technical foundations.

indicators.description: Number of features adopted into standards
Number of W3C Recommendations published
Time from proposal submission to feature adoption

outputs.statement: Governments, regulators, and public institutions reference, align with, and support W3C standards in policies, regulations, procurement requirements, and technical frameworks.

indicators.description: Number of government policies referencing W3C standards
Number of formal liaison relationships with governments and regulators
Number of regulatory or policy engagements involving W3C

outcomes.statement: People can use multiple independent tools and implementations to access and interact with the Web without functional limitations or lock-in.

indicators.description: Number of viable independent user agents and Web runtimes
Availability of key Web platform capabilities across implementations
Reduction of features restricted to a single implementation

outcomes.statement: The Web platform provides capabilities required for diverse global publishing, communication, and application use cases, enabling developers and organizations worldwide to choose the Web instead of alternatives.

indicators.description: Time lag between capability availability on Web vs non-Web platforms
Availability and adoption of capabilities such as advanced typography, graphics, media, offline support, and real-time communication

outputs.statement: Developers, implementers, and organizations from diverse regions and backgrounds participate in W3C standards development.

indicators.description: Track participation diversity across geography, organization size, sector, stakeholder type etc.
Contributor retention rates

outputs.statement: Designers, developers, implementers, and organizations bring requirements, use cases, and feature requests to W3C so that Web standards evolve to meet real-world needs.

indicators.description: Number of feature proposals submitted to W3C
Diversity of proposing organizations
Number of new use cases brought to Working Groups

outputs.statement: Working Groups adopt requirements and publish open, royalty-free Web standards that define interoperable technical foundations.

indicators.description: Number of features adopted into standards
Number of W3C Recommendations published
Time from proposal submission to feature adoption
